strengths: Rigorous experimental design with 2×2 factorial approach and 120 total experiments
Comprehensive evaluation across 5 datasets and two probing methods (linear and k-NN)
Appropriate statistical analysis including two-way ANOVA and Cohen's d effect sizes
Clear hypothesis testing with well-defined research question
Proper control of variables (same parameter count, same pre-training)
weaknesses: Paper appears incomplete - cuts off mid-sentence in Related Work section
Missing methodology details (hyperparameters, training procedures, evaluation protocols)
No results section presented despite claiming to have results
No discussion of limitations or future work
questions: What specific hyperparameters were used for training DeiT-Small and ResNet-34?
What pre-training method was used (supervised, MoCo v3, other)?
How exactly were linear probing and k-NN evaluation implemented?
What were the actual numerical results across all datasets and conditions?
Why does the paper end abruptly mid-sentence in the Related Work section?
suggestions: Complete the missing sections (Methodology, Results, Discussion, Conclusion)
Provide complete hyperparameter details including learning rates, batch sizes, optimizer settings
Include the full results table with all 120 experiments organized by dataset and condition
Add a thorough limitations section discussing dataset biases, architecture choices, and evaluation protocols
Complete the reference list with all cited works properly formatted
Add code and data availability statement for reproducibility
